result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: filed by Atty Eric Sheets

Defendant has not received copy of information.
Court prints a copy of the Information for Atty Redfield.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

3:15 PM Defendant Danielle Stephanie Borszowski in court, in custody.  Attorney Jared Redfield in court for Danielle Stephanie Borszowski.  Attorney Brian J Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Atty Redfield did not prepare a written waiver court does colloquy of waiver on the record.
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant's attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 

BY THE COURT: On the defendant's waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 13, 2022 at 09:30 am.

2:48 PM Defendant Danielle Stephanie Borszowski appeared by video.  Attorney Jared Redfield in court for Danielle Stephanie Borszowski. Attorney Andy Mutchler for Brian J Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin.
Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney does not waive time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on April 25, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: filed by Atty Anne Renc
Initial Appearance set for April 18, 2022 @ 2:30 p.m in Br 1
Citation

Remain absolutely sober from any controlled substance for which she does not have a valid written prescription. 
Do not operate a motor vehicle unless absolutely sober from any controlled substance whether she has a prescription or not.
Participate in the Portage County Pre-Trial Supervision Program and comply with the requirements for reporting, assessment, and programming.

1:41 PM Defendant Danielle Borzowski appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Maxwell Bergner for Danielle Borzowski appeared in court, Attorney Brian J Pfeil for State of Wisconsin appeared in court. 

ADA Pfeil states facts for anticipated charges of OWI - 8th offense. 
Court questions Atty Pfeil regarding the prior convictions.
Atty Bergner states the defendant is eligible for public defender representation. 
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

State requests a $50,000 cash bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Bergner makes bond arguments to the court and requests a lower cash amount of around $1,000.
Hearing scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
